text:
Installed on a Windows XP Professional SP 3, Apache crashes on startup.

Here a copy of the Eventlog:

Ereignistyp:	Fehler
Ereignisquelle:	Application Error
Ereigniskategorie:	(100)
Ereigniskennung:	1000
Datum:		17.02.2009
Zeit:		19:15:56
Benutzer:		Nicht zutreffend
Computer:	BLABLA
Beschreibung:
Fehlgeschlagene Anwendung httpd.exe, Version 2.2.11.0, fehlgeschlagenes Modul libapr-1.dll, Version 1.3.3.0, Fehleradresse 0x00006d1c.

Weitere Informationen über die Hilfe- und Supportdienste erhalten Sie unter http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/events.asp.
Daten:
0000: 41 70 70 6c 69 63 61 74   Applicat
0008: 69 6f 6e 20 46 61 69 6c   ion Fail
0010: 75 72 65 20 20 68 74 74   ure  htt
0018: 70 64 2e 65 78 65 20 32   pd.exe 2
0020: 2e 32 2e 31 31 2e 30 20   .2.11.0 
0028: 69 6e 20 6c 69 62 61 70   in libap
0030: 72 2d 31 2e 64 6c 6c 20   r-1.dll 
0038: 31 2e 33 2e 33 2e 30 20   1.3.3.0 
0040: 61 74 20 6f 66 66 73 65   at offse
0048: 74 20 30 30 30 30 36 64   t 00006d
0050: 31 63                     1c
creator: joerg@gelfert-haltern.de
tanguy.mezzano@gmail.com
text:
Hello,

same situation with WinXP SP2.

After doing a dependency check on libapr-1.dll, it seems that following dlls are in cause:

ADVAPI32.DLL
SHLWAPI.DLL
USER32.DLL
MPR.DLL
DWMAPI.DLL

Is there a followup for this bug???

Thanks,

Tanguy Mezzano

creator: joerg@gelfert-haltern.de
text:
The follow up doesn't solve the problem:

The bug depends on the installation. I have two vmware-machines running XP. Both with SP2. There ist one machine with, the other without the crash.

Depenency check outputs the same dlls you commented.

I'd like to compile and debug apache, but the priority is not high because I can run apache on the other virtual machine or on a virtual machine with linux.

creator: wrowe@apache.org

text:
This bug has been in NEEDINFO for several years, and it is related to an old version of Apache. I am inclined to close it, but please re-open it if you need further follow ups!

Luca
creator: toscano.luca@gmail.com
